message.content:
Analyze this Spartan Labs trading website codebase to understand:

1. The overall architecture - how are the different components organized? What are the main systems?
2. What API servers exist and how do they work together?
3. How is data persistence handled?
4. What are the key autonomous systems mentioned in various files?
5. Look for any existing documentation files (README, setup guides, architecture docs) that explain the system design
6. Identify any build/deployment processes
7. Check for configuration files and understand the tech stack

Focus on understanding the "big picture" - what this system does, how it's organized, and how the pieces fit together. Return a comprehensive summary of the architecture including:
- Main functional areas/modules
- API server architecture and endpoints
- Data flow and persistence mechanisms
- Key autonomous systems
- Technology stack
- Common development workflows if documented

Thoroughness level: very thorough

1â†’# ğŸ›ï¸ SPARTAN ARCHITECTURE MANTRA
     2â†’
     3â†’**Established**: 2025-11-02  
     4â†’**Status**: PERMANENT ARCHITECTURAL PRINCIPLE
     5â†’
     6â†’---
     7â†’
     8â†’## âš¡ THE MANTRA
     9â†’
    10â†’```
    11â†’ALL SCRIPTS CONVERGE TO START_SPARTAN.bat
    12â†’```
    13â†’
    14â†’This is not a temporary solution. This is **THE WAY** going forward.
    15â†’
    16â†’---
    17â†’
    18â†’## ğŸ¯ Core Principles
    19â†’
    20â†’### 1. Single Entry Point
    21â†’**There shall be ONE master launcher: `START_SPARTAN.bat`**
    22â†’
    23â†’- âœ… All new services integrate into START_SPARTAN.bat
    24â†’- âœ… No standalone startup scripts
    25â†’- âœ… No fragmented service management
    26â†’- âŒ Never create individual startup scripts that bypass the master
    27â†’
    28â†’### 2. Orchestrated Startup
    29â†’**All services start in proper order through the master launcher**
    30â†’
    31â†’```
    32â†’START_SPARTAN.bat orchestrates:
    33â†’    â”œâ”€> Database services
    34â†’    â”œâ”€> API services
    35â†’    â”œâ”€> Web services
    36â†’    â””â”€> User interface
    37â†’```
    38â†’
    39â†’### 3. Unified Shutdown
    40â†’**There shall be ONE master shutdown: `SPARTAN_STOP.bat`**
    41â†’
    42â†’- âœ… All services stop cleanly
    43â†’- âœ… Proper cleanup sequence
    44â†’- âœ… No orphaned processes
    45â†’- âŒ Never terminate services manually
    46â†’
    47â†’---
    48â†’
    49â†’## ğŸ“œ Architectural Laws
    50â†’
    51â†’### Law #1: No Fragmentation
    52â†’**Never create standalone startup scripts**
    53â†’
    54â†’âŒ **WRONG:**
    55â†’```batch
    56â†’CREATE_NEW_SERVICE.bat      (standalone script)
    57â†’START_FEATURE_X.bat          (bypasses master)
    58â†’launch_service_y.bat         (not integrated)
    59â†’```
    60â†’
    61â†’âœ… **RIGHT:**
    62â†’```batch
    63â†’Integrate into START_SPARTAN.bat:
    64â†’    â”œâ”€> Service already in master launcher
    65â†’    â”œâ”€> Or add new service to startup sequence
    66â†’    â””â”€> Update documentation
    67â†’```
    68â†’
    69â†’### Law #2: Sequential Integration
    70â†’**New services must integrate into startup sequence**
    71â†’
    72â†’When adding a new service:
    73â†’1. Add to START_SPARTAN.bat in appropriate order
    74â†’2. Add to SPARTAN_STOP.bat cleanup sequence
    75â†’3. Update documentation
    76â†’4. Test full startup/shutdown cycle
    77â†’
    78â†’### Law #3: User Simplicity
    79â†’**Users should never manage individual services**
    80â†’
    81â†’âœ… **User Experience:**
    82â†’```
    83â†’START_SPARTAN.bat  â†’  Everything starts
    84â†’SPARTAN_STOP.bat   â†’  Everything stops
    85â†’```
    86â†’
    87â†’âŒ **What to Avoid:**
    88â†’```
    89â†’User should NOT:
    90â†’- Start services individually
    91â†’- Remember different ports
    92â†’- Check if dependencies are running
    93â†’- Manually open browser
    94â†’- Manage multiple windows
    95â†’```
    96â†’
    97â†’---
    98â†’
    99â†’## ğŸ”§ Integration Template
   100â†’
   101â†’### Adding a New Service
   102â†’
   103â†’When creating a new service, follow this pattern:
   104â†’
   105â†’#### 1. Create Service File
   106â†’```python
   107â†’# new_service.py
   108â†’# Your service code here
   109â†’```
   110â†’
   111â†’#### 2. Add to START_SPARTAN.bat
   112â†’```batch
   113â†’REM ============================================================
   114â†’REM [X/Y] NEW SERVICE (Port XXXX)
   115â†’REM ============================================================
   116â†’echo [X/Y] Starting New Service...
   117â†’echo       Port: XXXX
   118â†’echo       Services: Description
   119â†’echo.
   120â†’
   121â†’start /min "Spartan New Service" cmd /c "python new_service.py"
   122â†’timeout /t 3 /nobreak >nul
   123â†’echo       âœ“ New service started
   124â†’
   125â†’echo.
   126â†’```
   127â†’
   128â†’#### 3. Add to SPARTAN_STOP.bat
   129â†’```batch
   130â†’REM ============================================================
   131â†’REM [X/Y] STOP NEW SERVICE (Port XXXX)
   132â†’REM ============================================================
   133â†’echo [X/Y] Stopping New Service...
   134â†’taskkill /F /FI "WINDOWTITLE eq Spartan New Service" 2>nul
   135â†’if errorlevel 1 (
   136â†’    echo       [INFO] New service not running
   137â†’) else (
   138â†’    echo       [OK] New service stopped
   139â†’)
   140â†’
   141â†’echo.
   142â†’```
   143â†’
   144â†’#### 4. Update Documentation
   145â†’- Update START_HERE_MASTER_LAUNCHER.md
   146â†’- Add service to architecture diagrams
   147â†’- Document new ports and endpoints
   148â†’- Update QUICK_START.txt
   149â†’
   150â†’---
   151â†’
   152â†’## ğŸ“Š Current Architecture (Reference)
   153â†’
   154â†’```
   155â†’START_SPARTAN.bat
   156â†’    â”‚
   157â†’    â”œâ”€> [1/4] Database Backend (Port 5002)
   158â†’    â”‚         â”œâ”€ PostgreSQL integration
   159â†’    â”‚         â”œâ”€ Intermarket relationships
   160â†’    â”‚         â””â”€ 17 normalized tables
   161â†’    â”‚
   162â†’    â”œâ”€> [2/4] Harmonic Cycle API (Port 8000)
   163â†’    â”‚         â”œâ”€ Forecasting engine
   164â†’    â”‚         â””â”€ Pattern predictions
   165â†’    â”‚
   166â†’    â”œâ”€> [3/4] Main Web Server (Port 9000)
   167â†’    â”‚         â”œâ”€ All HTML pages
   168â†’    â”‚         â”œâ”€ Symbol research
   169â†’    â”‚         â””â”€ Pattern discovery
   170â†’    â”‚
   171â†’    â””â”€> [4/4] Browser Launch
   172â†’              â””â”€ Opens: http://localhost:9000/index.html
   173â†’```
   174â†’
   175â†’---
   176â†’
   177â†’## ğŸš« Anti-Patterns to Avoid
   178â†’
   179â†’### âŒ Creating Standalone Scripts
   180â†’```batch
   181â†’# DON'T DO THIS:
   182â†’START_MY_NEW_FEATURE.bat
   183â†’launch_special_service.bat
   184â†’run_background_task.bat
   185â†’```
   186â†’
   187â†’**Why it's bad:**
   188â†’- Fragments user experience
   189â†’- Users forget to run it
   190â†’- Dependency management nightmare
   191â†’- No orchestration
   192â†’
   193â†’### âŒ Bypassing Master Launcher
   194â†’```batch
   195â†’# DON'T DO THIS:
   196â†’REM Starting my service independently
   197â†’python my_service.py
   198â†’```
   199â†’
   200â†’**Why it's bad:**
   201â†’- Breaks startup sequence
   202â†’- No integration testing
   203â†’- Hard to maintain
   204â†’- Confuses users
   205â†’
   206â†’### âŒ Manual Service Management
   207â†’```batch
   208â†’# DON'T TELL USERS TO DO THIS:
   209â†’"First run START_SPARTAN.bat"
   210â†’"Then separately run START_FEATURE_X.bat"
   211â†’"Open browser manually to..."
   212â†’```
   213â†’
   214â†’**Why it's bad:**
   215â†’- Too many steps
   216â†’- Error-prone
   217â†’- Not professional
   218â†’- Destroys user experience
   219â†’
   220â†’---
   221â†’
   222â†’## âœ… Best Practices
   223â†’
   224â†’### 1. Think Integration-First
   225â†’Before creating a new feature, ask:
   226â†’- "How does this integrate into START_SPARTAN.bat?"
   227â†’- "What's the startup order?"
   228â†’- "Does it have dependencies?"
   229â†’- "How does it shutdown cleanly?"
   230â†’
   231â†’### 2. Test the Full Cycle
   232â†’Every change must be tested:
   233â†’```batch
   234â†’# Test startup
   235â†’START_SPARTAN.bat
   236â†’â†’ All services start successfully
   237â†’
   238â†’# Test functionality
   239â†’â†’ All features work correctly
   240â†’
   241â†’# Test shutdown
   242â†’SPARTAN_STOP.bat
   243â†’â†’ All services stop cleanly
   244â†’```
   245â†’
   246â†’### 3. Document Everything
   247â†’For every new integration:
   248â†’- Update START_HERE_MASTER_LAUNCHER.md
   249â†’- Add to architecture diagrams
   250â†’- Document ports and URLs
   251â†’- Update QUICK_START.txt
   252â†’
   253â†’### 4. User-Centric Design
   254â†’Always prioritize user simplicity:
   255â†’- One command to start
   256â†’- One command to stop
   257â†’- Clear status messages
   258â†’- Automatic error handling
   259â†’
   260â†’---
   261â†’
   262â†’## ğŸ“ˆ Future Growth Pattern
   263â†’
   264â†’As the system grows, maintain the mantra:
   265â†’
   266â†’### Adding New Services
   267â†’```
   268â†’New Service Identified
   269â†’    â†“
   270â†’Integrate into START_SPARTAN.bat
   271â†’    â†“
   272â†’Add to SPARTAN_STOP.bat
   273â†’    â†“
   274â†’Update Documentation
   275â†’    â†“
   276â†’Test Full Cycle
   277â†’    â†“
   278â†’âœ… Release
   279â†’```
   280â†’
   281â†’### Never Do This:
   282â†’```
   283â†’New Service Identified
   284â†’    â†“
   285â†’Create standalone script âŒ
   286â†’    â†“
   287â†’Tell users to run it separately âŒ
   288â†’    â†“
   289â†’System becomes fragmented âŒ
   290â†’```
   291â†’
   292â†’---
   293â†’
   294â†’## ğŸ“ Teaching New Developers
   295â†’
   296â†’When onboarding new developers, teach them:
   297â†’
   298â†’### The Mantra:
   299â†’```
   300â†’"ALL SCRIPTS CONVERGE TO START_SPARTAN.bat"
   301â†’```
   302â†’
   303â†’### The Rule:
   304â†’```
   305â†’"If you're creating a startup script,
   306â†’you're doing it wrong."
   307â†’```
   308â†’
   309â†’### The Process:
   310â†’```
   311â†’"Integrate into master launcher,
   312â†’don't create standalone scripts."
   313â†’```
   314â†’
   315â†’---
   316â†’
   317â†’## ğŸ“‹ Code Review Checklist
   318â†’
   319â†’Before accepting any new feature:
   320â†’
   321â†’- [ ] Integrates into START_SPARTAN.bat?
   322â†’- [ ] Added to SPARTAN_STOP.bat?
   323â†’- [ ] Documentation updated?
   324â†’- [ ] No standalone startup scripts?
   325â†’- [ ] Full cycle tested?
   326â†’- [ ] User experience maintained?
   327â†’
   328â†’**If ANY checkbox is unchecked â†’ REJECT the change**
   329â†’
   330â†’---
   331â†’
   332â†’## ğŸ† Examples of Good Integration
   333â†’
   334â†’### âœ… Database Backend Integration
   335â†’```batch
   336â†’# Well integrated into START_SPARTAN.bat
   337â†’[1/4] Starting Database Backend (Port 5002)
   338â†’    â†“
   339â†’Service starts automatically
   340â†’    â†“
   341â†’User doesn't need to know it exists
   342â†’```
   343â†’
   344â†’### âœ… Harmonic API Integration
   345â†’```batch
   346â†’# Well integrated into START_SPARTAN.bat
   347â†’[2/4] Starting Harmonic API (Port 8000)
   348â†’    â†“
   349â†’Depends on database (starts after)

   353â†’
   354â†’### âœ… Intermarket Relationships
   355â†’```batch
   356â†’# Database integration done right

   358â†’    â†“
   359â†’No separate startup needed

   363â†’
   364â†’---
   365â†’
   366â†’## ğŸ¯ The Vision
   367â†’
   368â†’### Current State: âœ… ACHIEVED
   369â†’```
   370â†’ONE COMMAND â†’ Everything Works
   371â†’START_SPARTAN.bat
   372â†’```
   373â†’
   374â†’### Future State: ğŸ¯ MAINTAIN
   375â†’```
   376â†’Still ONE COMMAND â†’ More features
   377â†’START_SPARTAN.bat (with 10 more services integrated)
   378â†’```
   379â†’
   380â†’### What We Prevent: âŒ AVOID
   381â†’```

   386â†’```
   387â†’
   388â†’---
   389â†’
   390â†’## ğŸ“– Quotes to Remember
   391â†’
   392â†’> "A system with one entry point is infinitely more maintainable than a system with many."
   393â†’
   394â†’> "If a user has to think about which script to run, you've already failed."

   396â†’> "Integration is not optional - it's architectural."
   397â†’

   399â†’
   400â†’---
   401â†’
   402â†’## ğŸ”’ This is NOT Negotiable
   403â†’
   404â†’This architectural pattern is **PERMANENT**:
   405â†’
   406â†’- âœ… All future services integrate into START_SPARTAN.bat
   407â†’- âœ… User always runs ONE command
   408â†’- âœ… System remains unified and orchestrated
   409â†’- âŒ No exceptions for "special" services
   410â†’- âŒ No "temporary" standalone scripts
   411â†’- âŒ No fragmentation allowed
   412â†’
   413â†’---
   414â†’
   415â†’## ğŸ“œ Amendments
   416â†’
   417â†’This document can be amended, but the core principle never changes:
   418â†’
   419â†’**Core Principle (IMMUTABLE):**
   420â†’```
   421â†’ALL SCRIPTS CONVERGE TO START_SPARTAN.bat
   422â†’```
   423â†’
   424â†’**What Can Change:**
   425â†’- Implementation details
   426â†’- Startup sequence order
   427â†’- Service-specific configurations
   428â†’- Documentation improvements
   429â†’
   430â†’**What CANNOT Change:**
   431â†’- Single entry point requirement
   432â†’- Master launcher architecture
   433â†’- User simplicity mandate
   434â†’- Integration-first approach
   435â†’
   436â†’---
   437â†’
   438â†’## ğŸ‰ Summary
   439â†’
   440â†’### The Mantra:
   441â†’```
   442â†’ALL SCRIPTS CONVERGE TO START_SPARTAN.bat
   443â†’```
   444â†’
   445â†’### The Rules:
   446â†’1. Single entry point (START_SPARTAN.bat)
   447â†’2. Orchestrated startup sequence
   448â†’3. Unified shutdown (SPARTAN_STOP.bat)
   449â†’4. No standalone scripts
   450â†’5. Integration-first development

# ğŸ›ï¸ SPARTAN ARCHITECTURE MANTRA

**Established**: 2025-11-02  
**Status**: PERMANENT ARCHITECTURAL PRINCIPLE

---

## âš¡ THE MANTRA

```
ALL SCRIPTS CONVERGE TO START_SPARTAN.bat
```

This is not a temporary solution. This is **THE WAY** going forward.

---

## ğŸ¯ Core Principles

### 1. Single Entry Point
**There shall be ONE master launcher: `START_SPARTAN.bat`**

- âœ… All new services integrate into START_SPARTAN.bat
- âœ… No standalone startup scripts
- âœ… No fragmented service management
- âŒ Never create individual startup scripts that bypass the master

### 2. Orchestrated Startup
**All services start in proper order through the master launcher**

```
START_SPARTAN.bat orchestrates:
    â”œâ”€> Database services
    â”œâ”€> API services
    â”œâ”€> Web services
    â””â”€> User interface
```

### 3. Unified Shutdown
**There shall be ONE master shutdown: `SPARTAN_STOP.bat`**

- âœ… All services stop cleanly
- âœ… Proper cleanup sequence
- âœ… No orphaned processes
- âŒ Never terminate services manually

---

## ğŸ“œ Architectural Laws

### Law #1: No Fragmentation
**Never create standalone startup scripts**

âŒ **WRONG:**
```batch
CREATE_NEW_SERVICE.bat      (standalone script)
START_FEATURE_X.bat          (bypasses master)
launch_service_y.bat         (not integrated)
```

âœ… **RIGHT:**
```batch
Integrate into START_SPARTAN.bat:
    â”œâ”€> Service already in master launcher
    â”œâ”€> Or add new service to startup sequence
    â””â”€> Update documentation
```

### Law #2: Sequential Integration
**New services must integrate into startup sequence**

When adding a new service:
1. Add to START_SPARTAN.bat in appropriate order
2. Add to SPARTAN_STOP.bat cleanup sequence
3. Update documentation
4. Test full startup/shutdown cycle

### Law #3: User Simplicity
**Users should never manage individual services**

âœ… **User Experience:**
```
START_SPARTAN.bat  â†’  Everything starts
SPARTAN_STOP.bat   â†’  Everything stops
```

âŒ **What to Avoid:**
```
User should NOT:
- Start services individually
- Remember different ports
- Check if dependencies are running
- Manually open browser
- Manage multiple windows
```

---

## ğŸ”§ Integration Template

### Adding a New Service

When creating a new service, follow this pattern:

#### 1. Create Service File
```python
# new_service.py
# Your service code here
```

#### 2. Add to START_SPARTAN.bat
```batch
REM ============================================================
REM [X/Y] NEW SERVICE (Port XXXX)
REM ============================================================
echo [X/Y] Starting New Service...
echo       Port: XXXX
echo       Services: Description
echo.

start /min "Spartan New Service" cmd /c "python new_service.py"
timeout /t 3 /nobreak >nul
echo       âœ“ New service started

echo.
```

#### 3. Add to SPARTAN_STOP.bat
```batch
REM ============================================================
REM [X/Y] STOP NEW SERVICE (Port XXXX)
REM ============================================================
echo [X/Y] Stopping New Service...
taskkill /F /FI "WINDOWTITLE eq Spartan New Service" 2>nul
if errorlevel 1 (
    echo       [INFO] New service not running
) else (
    echo       [OK] New service stopped
)

echo.
```

#### 4. Update Documentation
- Update START_HERE_MASTER_LAUNCHER.md
- Add service to architecture diagrams
- Document new ports and endpoints
- Update QUICK_START.txt

---

## ğŸ“Š Current Architecture (Reference)

```
START_SPARTAN.bat
    â”‚
    â”œâ”€> [1/4] Database Backend (Port 5002)
    â”‚         â”œâ”€ PostgreSQL integration
    â”‚         â”œâ”€ Intermarket relationships
    â”‚         â””â”€ 17 normalized tables
    â”‚
    â”œâ”€> [2/4] Harmonic Cycle API (Port 8000)
    â”‚         â”œâ”€ Forecasting engine
    â”‚         â””â”€ Pattern predictions
    â”‚
    â”œâ”€> [3/4] Main Web Server (Port 9000)
    â”‚         â”œâ”€ All HTML pages
    â”‚         â”œâ”€ Symbol research
    â”‚         â””â”€ Pattern discovery
    â”‚
    â””â”€> [4/4] Browser Launch
              â””â”€ Opens: http://localhost:9000/index.html
```

---

## ğŸš« Anti-Patterns to Avoid

### âŒ Creating Standalone Scripts
```batch
# DON'T DO THIS:
START_MY_NEW_FEATURE.bat
launch_special_service.bat
run_background_task.bat
```

**Why it's bad:**
- Fragments user experience
- Users forget to run it
- Dependency management nightmare
- No orchestration

### âŒ Bypassing Master Launcher
```batch
# DON'T DO THIS:
REM Starting my service independently
python my_service.py
```

**Why it's bad:**
- Breaks startup sequence
- No integration testing
- Hard to maintain
- Confuses users

### âŒ Manual Service Management
```batch
# DON'T TELL USERS TO DO THIS:
"First run START_SPARTAN.bat"
"Then separately run START_FEATURE_X.bat"
"Open browser manually to..."
```

**Why it's bad:**
- Too many steps
- Error-prone
- Not professional
- Destroys user experience

---

## âœ… Best Practices

### 1. Think Integration-First
Before creating a new feature, ask:
- "How does this integrate into START_SPARTAN.bat?"
- "What's the startup order?"
- "Does it have dependencies?"
- "How does it shutdown cleanly?"

### 2. Test the Full Cycle
Every change must be tested:
```batch
# Test startup
START_SPARTAN.bat
â†’ All services start successfully

# Test functionality
â†’ All features work correctly

# Test shutdown
SPARTAN_STOP.bat
â†’ All services stop cleanly
```

### 3. Document Everything
For every new integration:
- Update START_HERE_MASTER_LAUNCHER.md
- Add to architecture diagrams
- Document ports and URLs
- Update QUICK_START.txt

### 4. User-Centric Design
Always prioritize user simplicity:
- One command to start
- One command to stop
- Clear status messages
- Automatic error handling

---

## ğŸ“ˆ Future Growth Pattern

As the system grows, maintain the mantra:

### Adding New Services
```
New Service Identified
    â†“
Integrate into START_SPARTAN.bat
    â†“
Add to SPARTAN_STOP.bat
    â†“
Update Documentation
    â†“
Test Full Cycle
    â†“
âœ… Release
```

### Never Do This:
```
New Service Identified
    â†“
Create standalone script âŒ
    â†“
Tell users to run it separately âŒ
    â†“
System becomes fragmented âŒ
```

---

## ğŸ“ Teaching New Developers

When onboarding new developers, teach them:

### The Mantra:
```
"ALL SCRIPTS CONVERGE TO START_SPARTAN.bat"
```

### The Rule:
```
"If you're creating a startup script,
you're doing it wrong."
```

### The Process:
```
"Integrate into master launcher,
don't create standalone scripts."
```

---

## ğŸ“‹ Code Review Checklist

Before accepting any new feature:

- [ ] Integrates into START_SPARTAN.bat?
- [ ] Added to SPARTAN_STOP.bat?
- [ ] Documentation updated?
- [ ] No standalone startup scripts?
- [ ] Full cycle tested?
- [ ] User experience maintained?

**If ANY checkbox is unchecked â†’ REJECT the change**

---

## ğŸ† Examples of Good Integration

### âœ… Database Backend Integration
```batch
# Well integrated into START_SPARTAN.bat
[1/4] Starting Database Backend (Port 5002)
    â†“
Service starts automatically
    â†“
User doesn't need to know it exists
```

### âœ… Harmonic API Integration
```batch
# Well integrated into START_SPARTAN.bat
[2/4] Starting Harmonic API (Port 8000)
    â†“
Depends on database (starts after)
    â†“
Web pages consume it automatically
```

### âœ… Intermarket Relationships
```batch
# Database integration done right
Uses database backend (already running)
    â†“
No separate startup needed
    â†“
Just works when page loads
```

---

## ğŸ¯ The Vision

### Current State: âœ… ACHIEVED
```
ONE COMMAND â†’ Everything Works
START_SPARTAN.bat
```

### Future State: ğŸ¯ MAINTAIN
```
Still ONE COMMAND â†’ More features
START_SPARTAN.bat (with 10 more services integrated)
```

### What We Prevent: âŒ AVOID
```
User runs 15 different scripts
Forgets dependencies
Services start in wrong order
System is fragmented
```

---

## ğŸ“– Quotes to Remember

> "A system with one entry point is infinitely more maintainable than a system with many."

> "If a user has to think about which script to run, you've already failed."

> "Integration is not optional - it's architectural."

> "The master launcher is not a feature - it's the foundation."

---

## ğŸ”’ This is NOT Negotiable

This architectural pattern is **PERMANENT**:

- âœ… All future services integrate into START_SPARTAN.bat
- âœ… User always runs ONE command
- âœ… System remains unified and orchestrated
- âŒ No exceptions for "special" services
- âŒ No "temporary" standalone scripts
- âŒ No fragmentation allowed

---

## ğŸ“œ Amendments

This document can be amended, but the core principle never changes:

**Core Principle (IMMUTABLE):**
```
ALL SCRIPTS CONVERGE TO START_SPARTAN.bat
```

**What Can Change:**
- Implementation details
- Startup sequence order
- Service-specific configurations
- Documentation improvements

**What CANNOT Change:**
- Single entry point requirement
- Master launcher architecture
- User simplicity mandate
- Integration-first approach

---

## ğŸ‰ Summary

### The Mantra:
```
ALL SCRIPTS CONVERGE TO START_SPARTAN.bat
```

### The Rules:
1. Single entry point (START_SPARTAN.bat)
2. Orchestrated startup sequence
3. Unified shutdown (SPARTAN_STOP.bat)
4. No standalone scripts
5. Integration-first development

### The Promise:
```
Users run ONE command.
Everything works.
Always.
```

---

**This is THE WAY.**

**Now and forever.**

**No exceptions.**

---

**Last Updated**: 2025-11-02  
**Status**: PERMANENT ARCHITECTURAL PRINCIPLE  
**Authority**: System Architecture  
**Enforcement**: Code Review Required  

---

## ğŸ¯ Final Word

When in doubt, remember:

```
â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
â”‚                                    â”‚
â”‚  START_SPARTAN.bat                â”‚
â”‚                                    â”‚
â”‚  This is not a script.            â”‚
â”‚  This is the architecture.        â”‚
â”‚                                    â”‚
â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
```

# ALL API SERVERS - COMPLETE DEPLOYMENT

**Status:** âœ… **ALL SERVERS RUNNING**

**Date:** 2025-11-04

---

## ğŸ¯ Complete Server List

### All 6 Critical Servers Running

| Server | Port | Status | Purpose |
|--------|------|--------|---------|
| **Web Server** | 9000 | âœ… RUNNING | Main website (simple_server.py) |
| **Database** | 5432 | âœ… RUNNING | PostgreSQL backend (database_backend.py) |
| **Polygon Proxy** | 5003 | âœ… RUNNING | Polygon.io proxy (polygon_proxy.py) |
| **Market Gauges** | 5004 | âœ… RUNNING | 24 market indicators (market_gauges_api.py) |
| **CFTC COT** | 8765 | âœ… RUNNING | Commodity data (was already running) |
| **Symbol Data** | 8082 | âœ… RUNNING | **NEW!** Real-time quotes (simple_symbol_api.py) |

---

## ğŸš€ Latest Fix: Symbol Research Data

### Problem (User's Error)

```
ERROR: Data unavailable
UNAVAILABLE
All fields showing: N/A
```

**User Message:**
> "I am extremely disappointed after trying to fix this I still get this error on symbol research"

### Root Cause

**Missing Symbol Data API (Port 8082)**

The Symbol Research page calls:
```javascript
fetch(`http://localhost:8082/api/quote/${symbol}`)
```

But this server wasn't running!

### Solution

**Created: `simple_symbol_api.py`** (Flask-based, no dependencies)

**Features:**
- âœ… Runs on port 8082
- âœ… DIAMOND RULE compliant (deterministic fallback data)
- âœ… Based on recent market levels (NOT random)
- âœ… Works immediately (no FastAPI dependency)
- âœ… Covers 20+ major symbols (MSFT, AAPL, GOOGL, etc.)

**Fallback Data Structure:**
```python
FALLBACK_DATA = {
    'MSFT': {
        'price': 378.25,      # Recent market level
        'change': 3.80,       # Recent change
        'volume': 25000000,   # Typical volume
        'marketCap': '2.8T',  # Current market cap
        'pe': 35.2,           # Recent P/E
        'eps': 10.74,         # Recent EPS
        'div': 0.68,          # Recent dividend yield
        'sector': 'Technology'
    },
    # ... 19 more symbols
}
```

---

## ğŸ“Š Complete API Verification

### Test All APIs

**1. Web Server (Port 9000):**
```bash
curl http://localhost:9000
# Expected: HTML content
```

**2. Database (Port 5432):**
```bash
# PostgreSQL is running (internal)
```

**3. Polygon Proxy (Port 5003):**
```bash
curl http://localhost:5003/api/polygon/snapshot?symbol=AAPL
# Expected: JSON data or error (requires API key)
```

**4. Market Gauges (Port 5004):**
```bash
curl http://localhost:5004/api/gauges/all
# Expected: 24 gauges with data
```

**5. CFTC COT (Port 8765):**
```bash
# Already verified working
```

**6. Symbol Data (Port 8082):**
```bash
curl http://localhost:8082/api/quote/MSFT
# Expected: Full quote data (price, market, fundamentals)
```

---

## ğŸ›¡ï¸ API Server Architecture

### How The System Works

**Normal Operation (APIs Working):**
```
User opens Symbol Research
  â†“
Page loads symbol_research.html
  â†“
JavaScript calls fetch('http://localhost:8082/api/quote/MSFT')
  â†“
API responds successfully
  â†“
User sees real data
```

**Fallback Operation (API Down):**
```
User opens Symbol Research
  â†“
Page loads symbol_research.html
  â†“
JavaScript calls fetch('http://localhost:8082/api/quote/MSFT')
  â†“
API is down (connection refused)
  â†“
API returns fallback data from simple_symbol_api.py
  â†“
User sees deterministic fallback data (recent market levels)
```

**With simple_symbol_api.py:**
Even when Yahoo Finance is down, the API still returns deterministic fallback data, so users NEVER see "UNAVAILABLE".

---

## ğŸ“ DIAMOND RULE Compliance

### All Fallback Data is Deterministic

**simple_symbol_api.py:**
```python
# NOT random - based on recent market levels
FALLBACK_DATA = {
    'MSFT': {'price': 378.25, ...},  # Real recent price
    'AAPL': {'price': 178.50, ...},  # Real recent price
    # etc.
}
```

**market_gauges_api.py:**
```python
# NOT random - based on recent market levels
STATIC_GAUGE_DATA = {
    '^VIX': {'value': 15.2, 'prev': 14.8},
    'DX-Y.NYB': {'value': 106.5, 'prev': 106.2},
    # etc.
}
```

**ZERO Math.random() usage across entire system!** âœ…

---

### Windows (One Command)

**Option 1: Use existing batch file**
```batch
START_COMPLETE_SYSTEM.bat
```

**Option 2: Manual start all**
```bash
# Navigate to website directory
cd /mnt/c/Users/Quantum/Downloads/Spartan_Labs/website

# Start all servers in background
nohup python3 simple_server.py > server.log 2>&1 &
nohup python3 database_backend.py > database_backend.log 2>&1 &
nohup python3 polygon_proxy.py > polygon_proxy.log 2>&1 &
nohup python3 market_gauges_api.py > market_gauges.log 2>&1 &
nohup python3 simple_symbol_api.py > simple_symbol_api.log 2>&1 &

# Verify all running
ss -tln | grep -E ':(9000|5432|5003|5004|8765|8082)'
```

   251â†’4. **Performance Tuning**: Optimize execution speed based on metrics

   460â†’## ğŸ” Security & Safety
   461â†’
   462â†’### GOLDEN RULE Enforcement
   463â†’
   464â†’**Zero Tolerance Policy**:
   465â†’- Any Math.random() detection = CRITICAL ALERT + page disable
   466â†’- Missing symbols_database.json usage = CRITICAL ALERT
   467â†’- All CRITICAL alerts require human review before auto-healing
   468â†’
   469â†’### Validation Before Actions
   470â†’
   471â†’```python
   472â†’# Never auto-heal without validation
   473â†’def auto_heal(issue):
   474â†’    # Create backup
   475â†’    backup = create_backup(issue.file)
   476â†’
   477â†’    # Apply fix
   478â†’    apply_fix(issue)
   479â†’
   480â†’    # Validate fix
   481â†’    validation = run_full_test_suite()
   482â†’
   483â†’    if validation.passed():
   484â†’        commit_fix()
   485â†’    else:
   486â†’        restore_backup(backup)
   487â†’        alert_human_intervention()
   488â†’```

# Computer Use Agent Group Architecture
## Spartan Research Station - Autonomous Website Testing & Validation System

**Version**: 1.0.0
**Status**: Active Development
**Integration**: Meta-Orchestrator + Recursive Self-Improvement Framework

---

## ğŸ¯ Mission Statement

Deploy an autonomous group of specialized computer use agents that continuously monitor, test, and validate the Spartan Research Station website with **ZERO human intervention**, ensuring 100% uptime, perfect functionality, and complete compliance with GOLDEN RULES.

---

## ğŸ—ï¸ Agent Group Architecture

### Agent Hierarchy

```

---

## ğŸ¤– Agent Specifications

### 1. VISUAL SCANNER AGENT
**Role**: Visual validation using computer vision and screenshot analysis

**Responsibilities**:
- Take full-page screenshots of every page
- Analyze layout consistency (color scheme, spacing, alignment)
- Detect visual regressions (broken CSS, missing elements)
- Validate Spartan theme compliance (#0a1628, #FFD700, #00ff88)
- Check responsive design across screen sizes
- OCR text validation for critical sections
- Verify chart/graph rendering

**Tools**:
- Selenium WebDriver for browser automation
- PIL/Pillow for image processing
- OpenCV for visual comparison
- pytesseract for OCR validation
- Chrome DevTools Protocol for screenshot capture

**Output**:
- Visual validation report (JSON)
- Screenshot archive with timestamps
- Layout anomaly alerts
- Color scheme compliance score

---

### 2. LINK VALIDATOR AGENT
**Role**: Comprehensive link testing and navigation validation

**Responsibilities**:
- Crawl all internal links recursively
- Test external link availability (HTTP status codes)
- Validate anchor links (#section navigation)
- Check JavaScript navigation handlers
- Detect redirect loops and broken paths
- Verify API endpoint availability
- Test form submission links

**Tools**:
- requests library for HTTP checking
- BeautifulSoup4 for HTML parsing
- asyncio for concurrent link testing
- urllib for URL validation
- Selenium for JavaScript link testing

**Output**:
- Link health report (all links status)
- Broken link alerts with line numbers
- Redirect chain analysis
- Navigation flow diagram

---

### 3. FORMAT COMPLIANCE AGENT
**Role**: Enforce GOLDEN RULES and coding standards

**Responsibilities**:
- **GOLDEN RULE #1**: Scan for Math.random(), mock data, fake values
- **GOLDEN RULE #2**: Verify ALL pages use symbols_database.json
- Validate cache prevention headers on every page
- Check HTML5/CSS3 compliance
- Verify meta tags (charset, viewport, cache-control)
- Validate JavaScript console for errors
- Enforce color scheme variables usage
- Check accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1)

**Tools**:
- BeautifulSoup4 for HTML parsing
- cssutils for CSS validation
- JSHint integration for JavaScript linting
- axe-core for accessibility testing
- Custom regex patterns for GOLDEN RULE enforcement

**Output**:
- Compliance report card (0-100 score)
- GOLDEN RULE violation alerts (CRITICAL)
- Code quality recommendations
- Accessibility audit results

---

### 4. DATABASE INTEGRITY AGENT
**Role**: Validate symbols_database.json integrity and usage

**Responsibilities**:
- Verify symbols_database.json schema compliance
- Check for duplicate symbols across asset classes
- Validate market cap, sector, country data
- Count total symbols (should be 13,000+)
- Verify exchange coverage (25+ exchanges)
- Test database loading on all pages
- Monitor auto-update system status
- Validate symbol search functionality

**Tools**:
- JSON schema validator
- pandas for data analysis
- Custom validation rules
- Database version tracking

**Output**:
- Database health report
- Symbol count validation
- Duplicate detection report
- Schema compliance score
- Auto-updater status

---

### 5. PERFORMANCE MONITOR AGENT
**Role**: Page performance, load times, and optimization

**Responsibilities**:
- Measure page load times (target: <2 seconds)
- Analyze Core Web Vitals (LCP, FID, CLS)
- Monitor server response times
- Check for memory leaks in JavaScript
- Validate lazy loading implementation
- Test concurrent user simulation
- Monitor API response times
- Profile JavaScript execution

**Tools**:
- Lighthouse CLI for performance auditing
- Chrome DevTools Performance API
- locust for load testing
- memory-profiler for leak detection

**Output**:
- Performance scorecard (Google PageSpeed style)
- Load time trends over time
- Optimization recommendations
- Resource size breakdown

---

### 6. CACHE VALIDATOR AGENT
**Role**: Ensure no stale data, validate cache-busting

**Responsibilities**:
- Verify cache prevention headers on every page
- Test force_fresh.html functionality
- Monitor browser cache behavior
- Validate version timestamps
- Check service worker cache (if applicable)
- Test localStorage/sessionStorage clearing
- Verify CDN cache invalidation

**Tools**:
- requests with cache headers
- Selenium for browser cache testing
- Custom cache header validators

**Output**:
- Cache compliance report
- Stale content alerts
- Browser cache test results
- Force refresh validation

---

### 7. MASTER ORCHESTRATOR AGENT
**Role**: Coordinate all agents, aggregate reports, trigger actions

**Responsibilities**:
- Schedule agent execution (continuous, hourly, daily)
- Aggregate all agent reports into master dashboard
- Trigger auto-healing actions when issues detected
- Coordinate with Meta-Orchestrator for skill updates
- Generate executive summary reports
- Send alerts for CRITICAL violations
- Manage agent resource allocation
- Track agent performance metrics

**Tools**:
- APScheduler for job scheduling
- Redis for agent coordination
- WebSocket for real-time updates
- Custom dashboard API

**Output**:
- Master test dashboard (HTML)
- Executive summary report
- Alert notifications (email, webhook)
- Agent performance metrics

---

## ğŸ§  Recursive Self-Improvement System

### Learning Framework

Each agent implements:

1. **Experience Logging**: All test runs logged to SQLite database
2. **Pattern Recognition**: Identify recurring issues and optimize detection
3. **Skill Updates**: New validation rules added to agent skills
4. **Performance Tuning**: Optimize execution speed based on metrics
5. **False Positive Reduction**: Machine learning to reduce noise

### Skill Structure

```json
{
  "agent_id": "visual-scanner-001",
  "skills": [
    {
      "skill_name": "spartan_color_validation",
      "version": "1.2.0",
      "accuracy": 0.98,
      "false_positive_rate": 0.02,
      "learned_patterns": [
        "rgb(10, 22, 40) -> #0a1628 conversion",
        "gold variations within tolerance"
      ],
      "improvement_suggestions": [
        "Add HSL color space validation"
      ]
    }
  ],
  "learning_metrics": {
    "tests_run": 15420,
    "bugs_found": 342,
    "false_positives_reduced": 87,
    "skill_updates": 23
  }
}
```

### Meta-Orchestrator Integration

**Bidirectional Communication**:
- Agents report findings to Meta-Orchestrator
- Meta-Orchestrator distributes new skills to agents
- Shared knowledge base across all 360+ agents
- Cross-pollination of testing strategies

**Skill Sharing Protocol**:
```python
# Agent discovers new validation pattern
new_skill = {
    "pattern": "detect_mock_data_via_timestamp_analysis",
    "effectiveness": 0.94,
    "false_positive_rate": 0.01
}

# Share with Meta-Orchestrator
meta_orchestrator.register_skill(new_skill)

# Meta-Orchestrator distributes to relevant agents
meta_orchestrator.broadcast_skill(
    skill=new_skill,
    target_agents=["format-compliance", "database-integrity"]
)
```

---

## ğŸš€ Deployment & Execution

### Continuous Monitoring Mode

```bash
# Start all agents in daemon mode
python computer_use_agent_master.py --mode=continuous --interval=300

# Runs full test suite every 5 minutes
# Auto-heals detected issues
# Generates real-time dashboard
```

### On-Demand Testing

```bash
# Run full test suite manually
python computer_use_agent_master.py --mode=full-scan

# Run specific agent
python computer_use_agent_master.py --agent=visual-scanner

# Test specific page
python computer_use_agent_master.py --page=symbol_search_connections.html
```

### Integration with Autonomous Startup

```python
# Enhanced autonomous_startup.py
from computer_use_agents import MasterOrchestrator

orchestrator = MasterOrchestrator()

# Pre-launch validation
validation_results = orchestrator.run_pre_launch_tests()

if validation_results.all_passed():
    launch_website()
else:
    orchestrator.auto_heal(validation_results.failures)
    # Re-validate after healing
    retry_validation_results = orchestrator.run_pre_launch_tests()
    if retry_validation_results.all_passed():
        launch_website()
    else:
        alert_human_intervention_needed(retry_validation_results)
```

---

## ğŸ“Š Reporting & Dashboards

### Master Dashboard (HTML)

**Location**: `/reports/master_dashboard.html`

**Sections**:
1. **Overall Health Score** (0-100)
2. **Agent Status Grid** (green/yellow/red)
3. **Critical Alerts** (GOLDEN RULE violations)
4. **Performance Trends** (charts over time)
5. **Recent Fixes** (auto-healing history)
6. **Skill Evolution** (learning metrics)

### Report Types

1. **Real-Time Dashboard**: Live updates via WebSocket
2. **Hourly Summary**: Email digest of key metrics
3. **Daily Deep Dive**: Comprehensive analysis with trends
4. **Weekly Executive Summary**: High-level insights for stakeholders

---

## ğŸ”§ Auto-Healing Capabilities

### Self-Healing Actions

| Issue Detected | Auto-Healing Action |
|----------------|---------------------|
| Broken internal link | Update link in HTML file |
| Missing cache headers | Inject headers into page |
| Stale symbols database | Trigger auto-updater |
| Slow page load | Enable lazy loading, compress images |
| Mock data detected | Alert + disable page until fixed |
| Color scheme violation | Auto-fix CSS variables |
| Dead external link | Replace with archived version or remove |

### Healing Confirmation

All auto-healing actions:
1. Log the original issue
2. Apply fix
3. Re-test to validate fix
4. Document in healing history
5. Report to Meta-Orchestrator for skill update

---

## ğŸ“ Skill Evolution Examples

### Example 1: Visual Scanner Agent Learns New Pattern

**Initial Skill**: Detect color #0a1628 only in hex format

**Test Failure**: CSS uses `rgb(10, 22, 40)`

**Learning Process**:
1. Agent detects "failure" (color not found)
2. Analyzes HTML/CSS and finds RGB equivalent
3. Adds RGB-to-hex conversion to skill
4. Re-runs test successfully
5. Shares conversion skill with Format Compliance Agent

**Result**: Skill v1.0 â†’ v1.1 (now detects both hex and RGB)

### Example 2: Link Validator Agent Optimizes

**Initial Behavior**: Test all links sequentially (slow)

**Performance Metric**: 500 links take 8 minutes

**Learning Process**:
1. Agent analyzes execution time logs
2. Identifies bottleneck (sequential I/O)
3. Implements async/await concurrent testing
4. Re-tests with 50 concurrent requests
5. Updates skill with concurrency parameters

**Result**: 500 links now take 45 seconds (10.6x faster)

---

## ğŸ“‹ Test Coverage Matrix

| Page | Visual | Links | Format | Database | Performance | Cache |
|------|--------|-------|--------|----------|-------------|-------|
| index.html | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… |
| symbol_research.html | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… |
| symbol_search_connections.html | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… |
| roce_research.html | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… |
| seasonality.html | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… |
| force_fresh.html | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… | N/A | âœ… | âœ… |
| test_symbol_database.html | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… |
| (All 27 pages) | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… |

---

## ğŸ” Security & Safety

### GOLDEN RULE Enforcement

**Zero Tolerance Policy**:
- Any Math.random() detection = CRITICAL ALERT + page disable
- Missing symbols_database.json usage = CRITICAL ALERT
- All CRITICAL alerts require human review before auto-healing

### Validation Before Actions

```python
# Never auto-heal without validation
def auto_heal(issue):
    # Create backup
    backup = create_backup(issue.file)

    # Apply fix
    apply_fix(issue)

    # Validate fix
    validation = run_full_test_suite()

    if validation.passed():
        commit_fix()
    else:
        restore_backup(backup)
        alert_human_intervention()
```

---

## ğŸ“ˆ Success Metrics

### Agent Performance KPIs

1. **Detection Accuracy**: >99% (false positives <1%)
2. **Test Coverage**: 100% of all pages
3. **Auto-Healing Success Rate**: >95%
4. **Average Response Time**: <30 seconds from issue to fix
5. **Skill Evolution Rate**: +5% accuracy per month
6. **Uptime**: 99.99% website availability

### Learning Metrics

1. **New Skills Added**: Track monthly
2. **Skill Accuracy Improvement**: Measure quarterly
3. **False Positive Reduction**: Track weekly
4. **Cross-Agent Knowledge Transfer**: Count shared skills

---

## ğŸ¯ Roadmap

### Phase 1: Foundation (Current)
- âœ… Architecture design
- â³ Core agent implementation
- â³ Basic testing framework

### Phase 2: Intelligence (Next)
- â³ Machine learning integration
- â³ Advanced pattern recognition
- â³ Predictive issue detection

### Phase 3: Autonomy (Future)
- â³ Full auto-healing without human review
- â³ Self-scaling agent deployment
- â³ Quantum optimization algorithms

---

## ğŸ“š Agent Communication Protocol

### Message Format

```json
{
  "timestamp": "2025-10-21T14:30:00Z",
  "from_agent": "visual-scanner-001",
  "to_agent": "master-orchestrator",
  "message_type": "test_result",
  "priority": "high",
  "payload": {
    "test_id": "visual-scan-20251021-143000",

      "/reports/screenshots/symbol_search_20251021_143000.png"
    ],

      "layout_score": 0.98,
      "visual_regression": false
    }
  }
}
```

### Inter-Agent Coordination

```python
# Example: Link Validator finds broken link
link_validator.detect_broken_link("/old-page.html")

# Notify Visual Scanner to verify page existence
link_validator.notify("visual-scanner", {
    "action": "verify_page_exists",
    "url": "/old-page.html"
})

# Visual Scanner confirms page missing
visual_scanner.respond({
    "status": "page_not_found",
    "recommendation": "update_all_references"
})

# Format Compliance Agent scans for references

# Master Orchestrator aggregates and auto-heals

    "issue": "broken_link",
    "target": "/old-page.html",
    "action": "remove_all_references"
})
```

---

## ğŸŒŸ Conclusion

This Computer Use Agent Group represents a **fully autonomous, self-improving website quality assurance system** that:

1. âœ… **Continuously monitors** all website functionality
2. âœ… **Enforces GOLDEN RULES** with zero tolerance
3. âœ… **Auto-heals** detected issues without human intervention
4. âœ… **Learns and improves** through recursive self-improvement
5. âœ… **Coordinates with Meta-Orchestrator** for system-wide intelligence
6. âœ… **Ensures 100% uptime** through proactive monitoring

**The user should NEVER see errors, bugs, or broken functionality.**

This is the **DIAMOND RULE** in action.

# âš”ï¸ Spartan Intermarket Barometers

## ğŸ¯ What This Does

Predicts market direction **6-18 months in advance** using 10 proven leading indicators:

### Tier 1: Ultra-Early Warning (6-18 Months Lead Time)
1. **Credit Spreads** - High Yield & Investment Grade (FRED)
2. **Yield Curve** - 10Y-2Y Treasury spread (FRED)
3. **China Credit Impulse** - Global growth proxy

### Tier 2: Early Warning (3-6 Months Lead Time)
4. **Copper/Gold Ratio** - Economic health indicator (Yahoo Finance)
5. **Baltic Dry Index** - Global trade barometer
6. **Market Breadth** - Stock participation metrics

### Tier 3: Short-Term Signals (1-3 Months Lead Time)
7. **AUD/JPY** - Ultimate risk-on/risk-off pair (Yahoo Finance)
8. **VIX** - Volatility index (FRED)
9. **Put/Call Ratios** - Sentiment extremes
10. **Emerging Markets** - First to fall in crises (Yahoo Finance)

## ğŸ”¥ Key Features

âœ… **NO FAKE DATA** - All indicators from verified sources (FRED, Yahoo Finance)
âœ… **Real-Time Updates** - Auto-refreshes every 15 minutes
âœ… **Composite Risk Score** - 0-100 scale (RED/YELLOW/GREEN)
âœ… **PostgreSQL Database** - Production-grade storage (NO SQLite)
âœ… **Historical Tracking** - 24-hour and 7-day trend analysis
âœ… **API Endpoints** - RESTful API for integration

## ğŸ“Š Composite Risk Score

**How it works:**
- Each indicator is weighted by importance
- Credit spreads: 20 points (most important)
- Yield curve: 15 points
- Copper/gold: 10 points
- AUD/JPY: 10 points
- VIX: 10 points
- Market breadth: 10 points
- China credit: 15 points
- EM indicators: 5 points
- PMI: 3 points
- Put/call ratios: 2 points

**Score Interpretation:**
- **75-100 (GREEN)**: All clear - Markets healthy
- **50-74 (YELLOW)**: Moderate caution - Some warnings
- **25-49 (YELLOW)**: Caution - Multiple stress signals
- **0-24 (RED)**: High risk - Crisis conditions

## ğŸš€ Quick Start

### 1. Get FRED API Key (FREE)
```
1. Go to https://fred.stlouisfed.org/
2. Create account (1 minute)
3. Get API key: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/docs/api/api_key.html
4. Copy your key
```

### 2. Configure Environment
```bash
# Edit .env.barometers
nano .env.barometers

# Replace YOUR_FRED_API_KEY_HERE with your actual key
FRED_API_KEY=your_actual_key_here
```

### 3. Start Barometers API
```bash
# Linux/WSL
./start_barometers.sh

# Windows
START_BAROMETERS.bat
```

### 4. View Dashboard
Open browser to:
- **Main Website**: http://localhost:8081/barometers.html
- **API Endpoint**: http://localhost:9001/api/barometers/latest

## ğŸ“¡ API Endpoints

### Get Latest Barometers
```bash
curl http://localhost:9001/api/barometers/latest
```

Returns:
```json
{
  "timestamp": "2025-11-08T16:30:00",
  "composite_score": 54,
  "risk_status": "YELLOW",
  "hy_spread": 305.2,
  "ig_spread": 74.8,
  "yield_curve_10y2y": 0.54,
  "copper_gold_ratio": 0.00077,
  "aud_jpy": 99.50,
  "vix": 18.25,
  "sp500": 6750.00,
  ...
}
```

### Get 24-Hour History
```bash
curl http://localhost:9001/api/barometers/history?period=24h
```

### Get Weekly History
```bash
curl http://localhost:9001/api/barometers/history?period=7d
```

### Manually Trigger Update
```bash
curl -X POST http://localhost:9001/api/barometers/update
```

## ğŸ—„ï¸ Database Schema

### Table: `intermarket_barometers`

Stores all barometer data with:
- Timestamp
- All 10 indicator values
- Composite score
- Individual signals (GREEN/YELLOW/RED)
- Data quality verification
- API source tracking

### Views Available:
- `latest_barometers` - Most recent reading
- `barometers_24h` - Last 24 hours
- `barometers_weekly` - Last 7 days

### Query Examples:
```sql
-- Get latest data
SELECT * FROM latest_barometers;

-- Get trend over 24 hours
SELECT timestamp, composite_score, risk_status
FROM barometers_24h
ORDER BY timestamp DESC;

-- Check data quality
SELECT COUNT(*) as total_updates,
       AVG(composite_score) as avg_score
FROM intermarket_barometers
WHERE timestamp >= NOW() - INTERVAL '7 days';
```

## ğŸ” Data Sources Verification

All data sources are tracked and logged:

**FRED (Federal Reserve Economic Data):**
- `BAMLH0A0HYM2` - High Yield spreads
- `BAMLC0A4CBBB` - Investment Grade spreads
- `DGS10` - 10-Year Treasury yield
- `DGS2` - 2-Year Treasury yield
- `VIXCLS` - VIX index

**Yahoo Finance:**
- `HG=F` - Copper futures
- `GC=F` - Gold futures
- `AUDJPY=X` - AUD/JPY forex
- `^GSPC` - S&P 500
- `EEM` - Emerging Markets ETF

Every data point includes its source in the API response:
```json
"api_sources": {
  "hy_spread": "FRED:BAMLH0A0HYM2",
  "copper_price": "Yahoo:HG=F",
  "aud_jpy": "Yahoo:AUDJPY=X"
}
```

## âš ï¸ Troubleshooting

### Issue: "No data available"
**Solution:**
1. Check FRED API key is configured in `.env.barometers`
2. Verify API key is valid: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/docs/api/api_key.html
3. Check API server logs for errors

### Issue: "Database connection failed"
**Solution:**
```bash
# Check PostgreSQL is running
sudo service postgresql status

# Start if needed
sudo service postgresql start

# Verify database exists
sudo -u postgres psql -c "\l" | grep spartan_website_db
```

### Issue: Some indicators showing "NO DATA"
**Solution:**
- Yahoo Finance data: Occasional rate limits, will update on next cycle (15 min)
- FRED data: Check API key, verify series ID is correct
- Check API logs for specific error messages

### Issue: Composite score seems wrong
**Solution:**
- Each indicator has thresholds for GREEN/YELLOW/RED
- Score is weighted sum of all indicators
- See `calculate_composite_score()` function in `barometers_api.py`
- Some indicators may be UNKNOWN (not counted in score)

## ğŸ“ˆ Usage Recommendations

### Daily Workflow:
1. **Morning Check** - Review composite score and status
2. **Identify Warnings** - Check which indicators are RED/YELLOW
3. **Read BLUF** - Executive summary of current conditions
4. **Historical Context** - Compare to yesterday/last week
5. **Action Plan** - Adjust portfolio based on risk level

### Signal Interpretation:

**Composite Score 75-100 (GREEN):**
- Maintain equity exposure
- Consider tactical long opportunities
- Monitor for deterioration

**Composite Score 50-74 (YELLOW):**
- Reduce equity to 60-70%
- Increase cash/bonds
- Avoid high-beta names

**Composite Score 25-49 (YELLOW):**
- Reduce equity to 40-50%
- Defensive positioning
- Consider hedges

**Composite Score 0-24 (RED):**
- Minimum equity (20-30%)
- Max defensive positioning
- Gold, cash, quality bonds

### Individual Indicator Actions:

**Credit Spreads WIDEN (RED):**
- Major warning - reduce risk immediately
- Historical lead time: 3-6 months

**Yield Curve INVERTS (RED):**
- Recession warning - begin defensive positioning
- Historical lead time: 6-18 months

**Copper/Gold CRASHES (RED):**
- Economic slowdown - reduce cyclicals
- Historical lead time: 1-3 months

**AUD/JPY BREAKS <95 (RED):**
- Risk-off event - immediate action needed
- Historical lead time: 1-7 days

**VIX SPIKES >40 (RED):**
- Market stress - often marks bottoms
- Historical lead time: 1-2 weeks (contrarian)

## ğŸ” Security & Compliance

### Data Security:
- API keys stored in environment variables
- Database access restricted to localhost
- No sensitive financial data stored
- All data from public sources

### Data Quality:
- Every data point marked as "VERIFIED"
- Source tracking for all indicators
- Error logging for failed updates
- Data quality flags in database

### Compliance:
- Historical analysis only (no forward predictions)
- Educational/research purpose
- Risk warnings on all pages
- No trading advice given

## ğŸ“š Additional Resources

### Documentation:
- `BAROMETERS_API_SETUP.md` - Detailed setup guide
- `barometers_schema.sql` - Database schema
- `barometers_api.py` - API source code
- `barometers.html` - Frontend source

### External Resources:
- FRED API Documentation: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/docs/api/
- Yahoo Finance: https://finance.yahoo.com/
- Original Research: See "Complete Intermarket Barometers Guide" in prompt

### Support:
- Check API logs for errors
- Verify database with `SELECT * FROM latest_barometers;`
- Test API endpoint: `curl http://localhost:9001/api/barometers/latest`
- Review setup guide: `BAROMETERS_API_SETUP.md`

---

## âœ… Success Checklist

- [ ] FRED API key obtained
- [ ] `.env.barometers` configured
- [ ] PostgreSQL running
- [ ] Database table created
- [ ] API server starts without errors
- [ ] Latest endpoint returns data
- [ ] Barometers page loads
- [ ] Composite score displayed
- [ ] Individual indicators showing
- [ ] Auto-refresh working
- [ ] All data from verified sources
- [ ] NO FAKE DATA anywhere

---

**Built with: Python 3, Flask, PostgreSQL, FRED API, Yahoo Finance**
**Purpose: Market timing and risk management through intermarket analysis**
**Data Policy: ZERO FAKE DATA - All indicators verified from official sources**

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Spartan Research Station - Intermarket Barometers API
CRITICAL: NO FAKE DATA - See CLAUDE.md PLATINUM RULE #1
PostgreSQL ONLY - See CLAUDE.md DIAMOND RULE #1

Data Sources (ALL VERIFIED, NO MOCK DATA):
- FRED API: Treasury yields, credit spreads, VIX, economic data
- Yahoo Finance: Forex, commodities, ETFs, indices
- Alpha Vantage: Backup for forex/commodities
"""

import os
import sys
import json
import requests
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
import psycopg2
from psycopg2.extras import RealDictCursor
import yfinance as yf
from flask import Flask, jsonify, request
from flask_cors import CORS

app = Flask(__name__)
CORS(app)

# Database Configuration - PostgreSQL ONLY (NO SQLITE)
DB_CONFIG = {
    'dbname': 'spartan_website_db',
    'user': 'postgres',
    'password': 'postgres',
    'host': 'localhost',
    'port': 5432
}

# Load API keys from .env.barometers file
def load_env_file():
    env_path = '.env.barometers'
    if os.path.exists(env_path):
        with open(env_path, 'r') as f:
            for line in f:
                if line.strip() and not line.startswith('#'):
                    key, value = line.strip().split('=', 1)
                    os.environ[key] = value

# Load environment variables
load_env_file()

# API Keys - Store in environment variables for production
FRED_API_KEY = os.getenv('FRED_API_KEY', 'YOUR_FRED_API_KEY')  # Get free key at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/
ALPHA_VANTAGE_KEY = os.getenv('ALPHA_VANTAGE_KEY', 'YOUR_ALPHA_VANTAGE_KEY')  # Get free key at https://www.alphavantage.co/

# FRED API endpoints
FRED_BASE = "https://api.stlouisfed.org/fred/series/observations"


def get_db_connection():
    """Get PostgreSQL database connection - NO SQLITE ALLOWED"""
    try:
        conn = psycopg2.connect(**DB_CONFIG)
        return conn
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"âŒ PostgreSQL connection error: {e}")
        return None


def fetch_fred_data(series_id, days_back=30):
    """
    Fetch data from FRED API - REAL DATA ONLY

    Args:
        series_id: FRED series identifier
        days_back: Number of days to look back for data

    Returns:
        Latest value or None if unavailable
    """
    if FRED_API_KEY == 'YOUR_FRED_API_KEY':
        print(f"âš ï¸  FRED API key not configured - Cannot fetch {series_id}")
        return None

    try:
        # Calculate date range
        end_date = datetime.now()
        start_date = end_date - timedelta(days=days_back)

        params = {
            'series_id': series_id,
            'api_key': FRED_API_KEY,
            'file_type': 'json',
            'observation_start': start_date.strftime('%Y-%m-%d'),
            'observation_end': end_date.strftime('%Y-%m-%d'),
            'sort_order': 'desc',
            'limit': 1
        }

        response = requests.get(FRED_BASE, params=params, timeout=10)
        response.raise_for_status()

        data = response.json()

    37â†’    })
    38â†’
    39â†’@app.route('/api/insights/list', methods=['GET'])
    40â†’def list_insights():
    41â†’    """Get all insights (newest first)"""
    42â†’    try:
    43â†’        limit = request.args.get('limit', 100, type=int)
    44â†’        category = request.args.get('category', None)
    45â†’

    49â†’        if category and category != 'all':

    51â†’

    55â†’            'insights': insights
    56â†’        })
    57â†’
    58â†’    except Exception as e:

    80â†’            })

# âš”ï¸ Breakthrough Insights Arsenal - Implementation Summary

## Overview
A comprehensive parallel AI agent system for generating and accumulating battle-tested market intelligence.

## ğŸ›¡ï¸ Core Components

### 1. **Parallel Agent System** (`novel_insights_agent_system.js`)
- **4 Specialized Agents Running in Parallel:**
  - âš”ï¸ **BreakthroughAgent**: Game-changing insights, institutional patterns, sector rotation
  - ğŸ›¡ï¸ **DiscoveryAgent**: Hidden correlations, options flow anomalies, intermarket relationships
  - ğŸ¯ **PatternAgent**: Fibonacci clusters, volume patterns, Elliott Wave analysis
  - ğŸ’¥ **TimingAgent**: COT positioning, seasonal windows, mean reversion setups

- **Parallel Execution**: All 4 agents run simultaneously using `Promise.allSettled()`
- **Performance Tracking**: Each insight includes processing time in milliseconds
- **Accumulation Storage**: All insights saved to localStorage with deduplication

### 2. **Insights Component** (`novel_insights_component.js`)
- **Spartan Military Theme**:
  - Battle-tested language: "Deploy Tactical Insight", "SPARTAN PROTOCOL"
  - Military icons: âš”ï¸ (breakthrough), ğŸ›¡ï¸ (discovery), ğŸ¯ (pattern), ğŸ’¥ (timing)
  - High-contrast colors: Gold (#FFD700), Crimson (#DC143C), Green (#228B22)

- **Multi-Agent Rendering**:
  - Grid layout for multiple insights per symbol
  - Category-based color coding
  - Impact badges (HIGH/MEDIUM)
  - Processing time display

### 3. **Dedicated Page** (`breakthrough_insights.html`)
Located at: `/breakthrough_insights.html`

**Features:**
- **Live Statistics Dashboard**:
  - Total insights accumulated
  - High impact count
  - Symbols analyzed
  - Latest agent run date

- **Category Filtering**:
  - All Insights
  - âš”ï¸ Breakthrough
  - ğŸ›¡ï¸ Discovery
  - ğŸ¯ Pattern
  - ğŸ’¥ Timing

- **Insights Display**:
  - Grouped by category with section headers
  - Card-based layout with hover effects
  - Symbol attribution
  - Date and processing time
  - Impact badges

- **Auto-Refresh**: Updates every 30 seconds

### 4. **Main Page Integration** (`index.html`)
- **Pinned Card** below Daily Planet showing:
  - Total insights collected (live count)
  - High impact insights (live count)
  - Spartan-themed tags
  - Direct link to full page

- **Live Stats**: Updates every 10 seconds via localStorage

### 5. **Keyboard Navigation** (`global_keyboard_controls.js`)
- **g + b**: Quick navigation to Breakthrough Insights Arsenal
- **?**: Show all keyboard shortcuts
- Press **? key** to see full help overlay

## ğŸš€ How It Works

### Generating Insights (VIX vs Symbol Example)

1. **User searches for a symbol** (e.g., AAPL)
2. **System shows loading state**: "Deploying Parallel Agents..."
3. **4 agents launch simultaneously**:
   ```javascript
   const insights = await novelInsightsAgentSystem.launchParallelAgents(symbol, marketData);
   ```
4. **Each agent analyzes independently** (500-1000ms)
5. **Results combined and displayed** in multi-card grid
6. **All insights saved to localStorage** (never removed)

### Viewing Insights

**From Main Page:**
- Click "Breakthrough Insights Arsenal" pinned card
- Shows total count and high impact count
- OR press **g + b** for keyboard navigation

**On Dedicated Page:**
- Filter by category (Breakthrough, Discovery, Pattern, Timing)
- View all accumulated insights
- See processing times and impact levels
- Auto-refreshes every 30 seconds

## ğŸ“Š Data Structure

### Insight Object
```javascript
{
  id: 1729123456789,
  date: "2025-10-19",
  symbol: "AAPL",
  category: "breakthrough",  // breakthrough | discovery | pattern | timing
  impact: "high",            // high | medium
  title: "Institutional Accumulation Pattern",
  insight: "Large institutional orders detected...",
  agentType: "breakthrough",
  processingTime: "567"      // milliseconds
}
```

### Storage Location
```javascript
localStorage.getItem('novel_insights_data')
// Structure:
{
  "vix_vs_symbol": {
    "insights": [...]
  },
  "harmonic_cycles": {
    "insights": [...]
  }
  // etc.
}
```

## ğŸ¨ Spartan Theme Colors

| Element | Color | Hex |
|---------|-------|-----|
| Primary | Spartan Red | #8B0000 |
| Accent | Crimson | #DC143C |
| Gold | Spartan Gold | #FFD700 |
| Green | Forest Green | #228B22 |
| Pattern | Gold | #FFD700 (changed from navy blue) |
| Timing | Orange | #FFA500 |

## ğŸ›¡ï¸ SPARTAN PROTOCOL

**Core Principle**: **Nothing is ever removed. Everything accumulates.**

- âœ… All insights are permanently stored
- âœ… New insights are continuously added
- âœ… Old insights remain accessible
- âœ… Total count always increases
- âŒ No delete functionality
- âŒ No clearing of insights
- âŒ No expiration

## ğŸ”§ Integration Points

### Add to New Page
```javascript
// 1. Include scripts
<script src="novel_insights_component.js"></script>
<script src="novel_insights_agent_system.js"></script>

// 2. Deploy agents
const insights = await window.novelInsightsAgentSystem.launchParallelAgents(
  symbol,
  marketData
);

// 3. Render insights
const manager = new NovelInsightsManager('page_key');
insights.forEach(i => manager.symbolInsights.set(`${symbol}-${i.category}`, i));
container.innerHTML = manager.renderSymbolInsightsMulti(symbol);
```

### Access All Insights
```javascript
const data = JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem('novel_insights_data') || '{}');
let allInsights = [];
Object.values(data).forEach(pageData => {
  if (pageData.insights) allInsights.push(...pageData.insights);
});
```

## ğŸ“ Files Created/Modified

### New Files
- âœ… `novel_insights_agent_system.js` - Parallel agent framework
- âœ… `breakthrough_insights.html` - Dedicated insights page
- âœ… `BREAKTHROUGH_INSIGHTS_README.md` - This file

### Modified Files
- âœ… `novel_insights_component.js` - Spartan theme, multi-agent rendering
- âœ… `index.html` - Pinned card, stats display
- âœ… `vix_vs_symbol.html` - Integrated parallel agents
- âœ… `global_keyboard_controls.js` - Added g+b shortcut

## ğŸ¯ Key Features

1. **Parallel Processing**: All 4 agents run simultaneously for fast analysis
2. **Accumulation**: Nothing is ever deleted - insights grow over time
3. **Live Stats**: Main page shows real-time count
4. **Category Filtering**: View specific types of insights
5. **Spartan Theme**: Military language, high contrast, bold design
6. **Keyboard Navigation**: g+b shortcut for quick access
7. **Auto-Refresh**: Page updates automatically every 30s
8. **Performance Metrics**: Each insight shows processing time
9. **Impact Levels**: HIGH and MEDIUM badges
10. **Symbol Attribution**: Each insight linked to specific symbol

## ğŸš€ Usage Examples

### Analyze a Symbol
```javascript
// On VIX vs Symbol page, search for AAPL
// Agents automatically deploy and generate insights
```

### View All Insights
```
Navigate to: breakthrough_insights.html
OR press: g + b
```

### Filter by Category
```
Click: âš”ï¸ Breakthrough, ğŸ›¡ï¸ Discovery, ğŸ¯ Pattern, or ğŸ’¥ Timing
```

## ğŸ“ Agent Templates

Each agent has 3 randomized templates to provide variety:

**BreakthroughAgent Examples:**
- Institutional Accumulation Pattern
- Breakthrough Support Level
- Sector Rotation Leader

**DiscoveryAgent Examples:**
- VIX Inverse Correlation Discovery
- Options Flow Anomaly
- Intermarket Leading Indicator

**PatternAgent Examples:**
- Fibonacci Time Cluster
- Volume Accumulation Pattern
- Elliott Wave Completion

**TimingAgent Examples:**
- COT Extreme Positioning
- Seasonal Window Opening
- Mean Reversion Setup

---

**Built with the Spartan spirit: Battle-tested. Never abandoned. Always accumulating.**

ğŸ›¡ï¸ **Nothing is ever removed. Everything accumulates.** âš”ï¸

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
ğŸ›¡ï¸ BULLETPROOF SPARTAN STARTUP - ULTIMATE MULTI-SERVICE SOLUTION
ğŸ’ DIAMOND RULE: User NEVER sees errors - EVER

This script guarantees:
âœ… Main server (8888) is 100% running before browser opens
âœ… CFTC API server (5001) is 100% running for COT screener
âœ… Automatic port cleanup if blocked
âœ… Health checks confirm ALL servers are responding
âœ… Servers stay running in background
âœ… Zero "connection refused" or "Backend API not running" errors - GUARANTEED
âœ… Works every single time - no exceptions

USER EXPERIENCE: Click â†’ 3-5 seconds â†’ Website opens perfectly with ALL features working
"""
import os
import sys
import time
import socket
import subprocess
import webbrowser
import urllib.request
from pathlib import Path

class BulletproofStartup:
    def __init__(self):
        self.main_port = 8888
        self.cftc_port = 5001
        self.main_url = f"http://127.0.0.1:{self.main_port}"
        self.cftc_url = f"http://127.0.0.1:{self.cftc_port}"
        self.website_dir = Path(__file__).parent
        self.max_retries = 20  # Increased to 20 for multiple services
        self.retry_delay = 1
        self.processes = []  # Track all background processes

    def log(self, emoji, message):
        """Clean logging"""
        print(f"{emoji} {message}")

    def is_port_in_use(self, port):
        """Check if port is already in use"""
        with socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM) as s:
            return s.connect_ex(('127.0.0.1', port)) == 0

    def kill_port(self, port):
        """Kill any process using specified port"""
        if not self.is_port_in_use(port):
            return True

        self.log("ğŸ”§", f"Port {port} is busy - clearing...")

        try:
            if sys.platform == 'win32':
                # Windows: Find and kill process on port
                result = subprocess.run(
                    f'netstat -ano | findstr :{port}',
                    shell=True,
                    capture_output=True,
                    text=True
                )

                if result.stdout:
                    lines = result.stdout.strip().split('\n')
                    for line in lines:
                        parts = line.split()
                        if len(parts) >= 5:
                            pid = parts[-1]
                            subprocess.run(f'taskkill /F /PID {pid}',
                                         shell=True,
                                         capture_output=True)

                time.sleep(1)

            else:
                # Linux: Kill process on port
                subprocess.run(
                    f"lsof -ti:{port} | xargs kill -9",
                    shell=True,
                    capture_output=True
                )
                time.sleep(1)

            self.log("âœ…", f"Port {port} is now free")
            return True

        except Exception as e:
            self.log("âš ï¸", f"Could not free port {port}: {e}")
            return False

    def start_main_server(self):
        """Start the main web server (port 8888)"""
        self.log("ğŸš€", "Starting main server (port 8888)...")

        server_script = self.website_dir / "start_server.py"

        if not server_script.exists():
            self.log("âŒ", "start_server.py not found!")
            return None

        try:
            if sys.platform == 'win32':
                # Windows: Start without console window
                process = subprocess.Popen(
                    ['python', str(server_script)],
                    cwd=str(self.website_dir),
                    creationflags=subprocess.CREATE_NO_WINDOW,
                    stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
                    stderr=subprocess.PIPE,
                    stdin=subprocess.PIPE
                )
            else:
                # Linux: Start in background
                process = subprocess.Popen(
                    ['python3', str(server_script)],
                    cwd=str(self.website_dir),
                    stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
                    stderr=subprocess.PIPE,
                    stdin=subprocess.PIPE
                )

            self.processes.append(process)
            return process

        except Exception as e:
            self.log("âŒ", f"Failed to start main server: {e}")
            return None

    def start_cftc_api(self):
        """Start the CFTC API server (port 5001)"""
        self.log("ğŸš€", "Starting CFTC API server (port 5001)...")

        cftc_script = self.website_dir / "cftc_data_api.py"

        if not cftc_script.exists():
            self.log("âš ï¸", "cftc_data_api.py not found - COT features will be unavailable")
            return None

        try:
            if sys.platform == 'win32':
                # Windows: Start without console window
                process = subprocess.Popen(
                    ['python', str(cftc_script)],
                    cwd=str(self.website_dir),
                    creationflags=subprocess.CREATE_NO_WINDOW,
                    stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
                    stderr=subprocess.PIPE,
                    stdin=subprocess.PIPE
                )
            else:

-- Spartan Research Station - Intermarket Barometers Database Schema
-- PostgreSQL 13+ Required (NO SQLITE - See CLAUDE.md Diamond Rule #1)

-- Drop existing table if recreating
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS intermarket_barometers CASCADE;

-- Main barometers data table
CREATE TABLE intermarket_barometers (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,

    -- Tier 1: Ultra-Early Warning (6-18 Months Lead Time)
    hy_spread NUMERIC(10, 2),                    -- High Yield spread (bps)
    ig_spread NUMERIC(10, 2),                    -- Investment Grade spread (bps)
    hy_ig_differential NUMERIC(10, 2),           -- HY-IG difference
    china_credit_impulse NUMERIC(10, 4),         -- China credit as % GDP
    yield_curve_10y2y NUMERIC(10, 4),            -- 10Y-2Y Treasury spread

    -- Tier 2: Early Warning (3-6 Months Lead Time)
    copper_price NUMERIC(10, 4),                 -- Copper price per lb
    gold_price NUMERIC(10, 4),                   -- Gold price per oz
    copper_gold_ratio NUMERIC(10, 8),            -- Copper/Gold ratio
    baltic_dry_index INTEGER,                    -- BDI
    market_breadth_pct NUMERIC(5, 2),            -- % stocks above 50-day MA

    -- Tier 3: Short-Term Signals (1-3 Months Lead Time)
    aud_jpy NUMERIC(10, 4),                      -- AUD/JPY exchange rate
    vix NUMERIC(10, 2),                          -- VIX index
    move_index NUMERIC(10, 2),                   -- MOVE Treasury volatility
    put_call_equity NUMERIC(10, 4),              -- CBOE Equity Put/Call
    put_call_spx NUMERIC(10, 4),                 -- SPX Put/Call
    eem_price NUMERIC(10, 2),                    -- Emerging Markets ETF

    -- Economic Data
    ism_manufacturing NUMERIC(5, 2),             -- ISM Manufacturing PMI
    ism_services NUMERIC(5, 2),                  -- ISM Services PMI
    treasury_10y NUMERIC(10, 4),                 -- 10-Year Treasury yield
    treasury_2y NUMERIC(10, 4),                  -- 2-Year Treasury yield

    -- Market Indices
    sp500 NUMERIC(10, 2),                        -- S&P 500 price
    russell2000 NUMERIC(10, 2),                  -- Russell 2000 price

    -- Composite Risk Score (0-100)
    composite_score INTEGER,
    risk_status VARCHAR(20),                     -- 'GREEN', 'YELLOW', 'RED'

    -- Individual Indicator Signals
    credit_signal VARCHAR(10),                   -- Signal status for each
    china_signal VARCHAR(10),
    curve_signal VARCHAR(10),
    copper_gold_signal VARCHAR(10),
    audjpy_signal VARCHAR(10),
    vix_signal VARCHAR(10),
    breadth_signal VARCHAR(10),
    em_signal VARCHAR(10),
    pmi_signal VARCHAR(10),
    putcall_signal VARCHAR(10),

    -- Metadata
    data_quality VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'VERIFIED', -- Data quality flag
    api_sources JSONB,                            -- Track which APIs provided data
    update_success BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
    error_log TEXT
);

-- Index for fast time-series queries
CREATE INDEX idx_barometers_timestamp ON intermarket_barometers(timestamp DESC);

-- Index for latest data retrieval
CREATE INDEX idx_barometers_latest ON intermarket_barometers(timestamp DESC, update_success);

-- Create view for latest barometer reading
CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW latest_barometers AS
SELECT * FROM intermarket_barometers
WHERE update_success = TRUE
ORDER BY timestamp DESC
LIMIT 1;

-- Create view for historical trend (last 24 hours)
CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW barometers_24h AS
SELECT * FROM intermarket_barometers
WHERE timestamp >= NOW() - INTERVAL '24 hours'
AND update_success = TRUE
ORDER BY timestamp DESC;

-- Create view for weekly trend
CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW barometers_weekly AS
SELECT * FROM intermarket_barometers
WHERE timestamp >= NOW() - INTERVAL '7 days'
AND update_success = TRUE
ORDER BY timestamp DESC;

-- Comments for documentation
COMMENT ON TABLE intermarket_barometers IS 'Real-time intermarket barometer data - NO FAKE DATA (see CLAUDE.md)';
COMMENT ON COLUMN intermarket_barometers.hy_spread IS 'High Yield corporate bond spread in basis points - SOURCE: FRED BAMLH0A0HYM2';
COMMENT ON COLUMN intermarket_barometers.ig_spread IS 'Investment Grade corporate bond spread in basis points - SOURCE: FRED BAMLC0A4CBBB';
COMMENT ON COLUMN intermarket_barometers.yield_curve_10y2y IS '10Y-2Y Treasury spread - SOURCE: FRED T10Y2Y';
COMMENT ON COLUMN intermarket_barometers.copper_gold_ratio IS 'Copper/Gold ratio - Critical economic indicator - SOURCE: Yahoo Finance GC=F, HG=F';
COMMENT ON COLUMN intermarket_barometers.vix IS 'CBOE Volatility Index - SOURCE: FRED VIXCLS or Yahoo ^VIX';
COMMENT ON COLUMN intermarket_barometers.composite_score IS 'Composite risk score 0-100 (0=max risk, 100=all clear)';
COMMENT ON COLUMN intermarket_barometers.data_quality IS 'Data quality verification - MUST be VERIFIED (no fake data allowed)';
